additional_login_field.description: The CSS Selector for any Additional Login Field required to login besides username and password, such as Company name or Agency ID. For example, the selector could be input#login-company-id. This entry is required only if there is an additional login field besides username and password.

selector_timeout.description: Use this field to indicate the number of milliseconds to wait for the expected input selectors to load before timing out on failure. A zero or negative number means no timeout.

submit_field.description: The CSS Selector for the Submit button in the login form, for example, input#login-button. This entry is optional. It is required only if you cannot submit the form by pressing the enter key.

additional_login_field.description: The CSS Selector for any Additional Login Field required to login besides username and password, such as Company name or Agency ID. For example, the selector could be input#login-company-id. This entry is required only if there is an additional login field besides username and password.

additional_login_field_value.description: The value for the Additional Login Field. For example, if there is an additional login field for the company name, enter the company name here. This entry is required if Additional Login Field is set.

default_profile_id.description: Default authentication profile ID

form_field.description: The CSS Selector for the form field of the login form, for example, form#loginForm.

hostname_suffix.description: The host name suffix for the url of the login form, for example, acme.com.

name.description: Name of the Web App

order.description: Use this field to specify the order of login if it is not username, password and submit.

password.description: Password for all user share one name

password_field.description: The CSS Selector for the password field in the login form, for example, input#login-password.

policy_script.description: Use script to specify authentication rules (configured rules are ignored)

script.description: Script to log the user in to this application

selector_timeout.description: Use this field to indicate the number of milliseconds to wait for the expected input selectors to load before timing out on failure. A zero or negative number means no timeout.

submit_field.description: The CSS Selector for the Submit button in the login form, for example, input#login-button. This entry is optional. It is required only if you cannot submit the form by pressing the enter key.

template_name.description: Template name of the Web App

use_ad_login_pw.description: Use the login password supplied by the user (Active Directory users only)

use_ad_login_pw_by_script.description: Use the login password supplied by the user for account mapping script (Active Directory users only)

username.description: All users share the user name. Applicable if 'username_strategy' is 'Fixed'

username_field.description: The CSS Selector for the user name field in the login form, for example, input#login-username.

policy_script.description: Use script to specify authentication rules (configured rules are ignored)

script.description: Script to log the user in to this application

selector_timeout.description: Use this field to indicate the number of milliseconds to wait for the expected input selectors to load before timing out on failure. A zero or negative number means no timeout.

submit_field.description: The CSS Selector for the Submit button in the login form, for example, input#login-button. This entry is optional. It is required only if you cannot submit the form by pressing the enter key.

template_name.description: Template name of the Web App

use_ad_login_pw.description: Use the login password supplied by the user (Active Directory users only)

use_ad_login_pw_by_script.description: Use the login password supplied by the user for account mapping script (Active Directory users only)

username.description: All users share the user name. Applicable if 'username_strategy' is 'Fixed'

username_field.description: The CSS Selector for the user name field in the login form, for example, input#login-username.

name.description: User or role name of the approver
User or role name of the approver

application_id.description: Application ID. Specify the name or 'target' that the mobile application uses to find this application.

name.description: Name of the Web App

script.description: Script to customize JWT token creation for this application

template_name.description: Template name of the Web App

application_id.description: Application ID. Specify the name or 'target' that the mobile application uses to find this application.

default_profile_id.description: Default authentication profile ID

name.description: Name of the Web App

policy_script.description: Use script to specify authentication rules (configured rules are ignored)

template_name.description: Template name of the Web App

user_map_script.description: Account mapping script. Applicable if 'username_strategy' is 'UseScript'

username.description: All users share the user name. Applicable if 'username_strategy' is 'Fixed'

application_url.description: Resource application URL. The OpenID Connect Service Provider URL

client_id.description: The OpenID Client ID for this Identity Provider

client_secret.description: The OpenID Client Secret for this Identity Provider

issuer.description: The OpenID Connect Issuer URL for this application

redirects.description: Authorized Redirect URIs. Redirect URI that the Service Provider will specify in the OpenID Connect request to Centrify

script.description: Script to generate OpenID Connect Authorization and UserInfo responses for this application

name.description: User or role name of the approver
User or role name of the approver

app_entity_id.description: Cloudera Entity ID or JIRA Cloud SP Entity ID

application_id.description: Application ID. Specify the name or 'target' that the mobile application uses to find this application.

authn_context_class.description: Select the Authentication Context Class that your Service Provider specifies to use. If SP does not specify one, select 'unspecified'.

corp_identifier.description: AWS Account ID or Jira Cloud Subdomain

default_profile_id.description: Default authentication profile ID

name.description: Name of the Web App

name_id_format.description: This is the Format attribute value in the <NameID> element in SAML Response. Select the NameID Format that your Service Provider specifies to use. If SP does not specify one, select 'unspecified'.

policy_script.description: Use script to specify authentication rules (configured rules are ignored)

recipient.description: Service Provider recipient if it is different from ACS URL

recipient_sameas_acs_url.description: Recipient is same as ACS URL

relay_state.description: If your Service Provider specifies a Relay State value to use, specify it here.

saml_script.description: Javascript used to produce custom logic for SAML response

sign_assertion.description: Sign assertion if true, otherwise sign response

sp_entity_id.description: SP Entity ID, also known as SP Issuer, or Audience, is a value given by your Service Provider

sp_metadata_xml.description: Service Provider metadata in XML format

template_name.description: Template name of the Web App

user_map_script.description: Account mapping script. Applicable if 'username_strategy' is 'UseScript'

username.description: All users share the user name. Applicable if 'username_strategy' is 'Fixed'

block.description: Map attributes from your source directory to SAML attributes that should be included in the SAML response for this application.
